intro: Salacistis fumata, commonly known as the smoky salacina, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from pale yellow to deep orange. Its leaves are typically opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Due to its limited habitat and endangered status, it is highly sought after by botanists and conservationists.
